Title: "Chili's can be a great place to work"
Pros: Great weekend job for students or those that want to make extra money on the weekend.
Cons: Sometimes capacity can be overwhelming, especially if there is an under-staffing issue.
Advice to Management: Remember to keep a healthy relationship with employees.

Title: "hard work, long hours, low pay"
Pros: It was great to eat for free each shift.
Cons: work nights, weekends, holidays, dirty, long hours, transient staff with very little investment in the restaurant
Advice to Management: Communication and working towards common goals is necessary.

Title: "Ok"
Pros: Easy Money, Flexibility for Students
Cons: Dead end job. No respect.

Title: "Great leadership"
Pros: Company really cares about people awesome culture
Cons: Aggressive labor plans Leaders put into position to much
Advice to Management: Less is more with rollouts etc

Title: "Be on top!"
Pros: Lovely atmosphere, work is easy if you know the menu. Great food and great location.
Cons: Management staff continues to recycle and bring in new managers, some of which are inexperienced and very disrespectful.
Advice to Management: Watch who you hire to be in charge.

Title: "Not the best"
Pros: Good camaraderie between servers/hosts and lots of regulars
Cons: Favoritism with management and lots of overworking
Advice to Management: Stop favoring specific people, be more open to feedback, follow your own rules

Title: "Server"
Pros:
-50% discount
-flexible shifts
-earning potential in tips
Cons:
-clique-like environment
-ridiculously low base
-poor communication

Title: "Overall experience depends on the market in which you work and, further, the Area Director (AD) you work under."
Pros: Amazing pay! Always have others to help you; Benefits are great--at least for someone like myself--single/no dependents. Conveniently located throughout the world so transferring (if needed) is usually not a problem unless you happen to be on bad terms of course! Menu is a favorite amongst all generations--attracting a LARGE and diverse crowd. While presentation and quality are the focus of Chili's food, the general feel is 'Laid Back' and comfortably casual. In short, this is the PERFECT beginning to anyone's career in restaurant management. Would I suggest it for someone looking to settle into a long-term restaurant management career? Absolutely not. A first timer? ABSOLUTELY.
Cons: Hours are TERRIBLE 60+hrs/weekly; Never able to set yourself on a schedule due to the differing shifts/hours worked week to week
Advice to Management: A little more follow through/follow up on feedback from managers and hourly staff. I would suggest ALL management staff throughout this company read 'The One-Minute Manager' at the start of their career.

Title: "awful organization"
Pros: They had updated ziosks which helped take off some of the load of serving. Customers could check themselves out or add on to their bill. They also had online service for the schedule so that it was easy to access.
Cons: Although there were many managers, the schedule didn't come out until the day before the week started. Even with that they would change it online midweek then wonder why people didn't show up to work. They had "team service" which they would purposefully pair a lesser server with a better one which ended up being the better server had to handle their section and pick up slack for the other server. The sections they made up were poorly planned out on top of that making one section made up of six six-tops that on days like sunday would be totally full.
Advice to Management: Be more organized. Make the schedule two at a time. You can't expect much from your staff when you yourself are not doing your job to the fullest. Putting the schedule out late basically tells your staff that their time means nothing. They just have to work whenever you say.

Title: "Managing partner"
Pros: Culture management benefits food team
Cons: Stress turnover long hours balance

Title: "Good place to work"
Pros: great work atmosphere. free food for cooks.
Cons: scheduling and not getting enough hires at times.

Title: "Corporate Management Is Ruining It For Everyone"
Pros: As far as the actual tasks required of you in the kitchen, it is one of the easiest jobs you could have in the industry. Everything you have to make is on posters with step by step guidelines on how to prepare it, everything has a timer associated with it, and ninety nine percent of the food just goes through a conveyor belt oven on the same plate its served on. hours and pay are the same as any other corporate restaurant chain.
Cons: Because they are a publicly traded stock, Brinker's (Chili's) corporate higher-ups constantly rollout more and more ways to save time and labor in the kitchen and front of house. I can't call them evil or cruel for doing this, its simply in the best interest of the company's growth. Unfortunately, the ones who pay the price are the ones at the bottom of the ladder, the cooks and the servers. While it sounds great and easy getting all your food already prepared and ready to eat, that means less labor hours for us back of house guys and girls. Over five years of working at Chili's I saw this firsthand. I watched a lot of talented people leave the company because they saw that the company was moving away from talent.
Advice to Management: Chili's, treat the little people who keep your restaurant running a little better. happy employees and a hardworking team can do a lot more than fancy ovens and frozen food.

Title: "Review"
Pros: Chili's is a great place to work. I have worked there for five years, and I could not have asked for a better job to get me through collage. My managers (all four of them) were reasonable, and incredibly flexible with my student schedule. If I need to change my work hours they did. If I needed time off they gave it to me. If you work hard, you will be respected.
Cons: It is retail, so annoying customers happen.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Flexible schedule, ability to make as much or as little money that you need
Cons: Management expects unrealistic things sometimes because they've forgotten what it's like to wait tables
Advice to Management: Try to remember how it was to be a server

Title: "Chili's used to be a great company, now it sucks."
Pros: easy to get a job
Cons: poor benefits, poor business model for employees, low kitchen wages, favoritism among management, low accountability, company does not value the employee

Title: "Server"
Pros: Got tips in cash that night
Cons: very understaffed when I was there, Worked lots of doubles. Money wasn't bad though

Title: "Garbage"
Pros: The workers are great and so is the environment
Cons: The managers do not advance
Advice to Management: Advance employees who show skills capable of advancement immediately.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: GREAT COMPANY, they really care and want to take care of you. They are always looking to promote with in
Cons: Long Hours, weekends, nights, holidays, buy hey its a restaurant so thats a con of any restaurant

Title: "Started as a hostess"
Pros: Always meet great and interesting people. Managers always push to bring you up to the next position.
Cons: Would get assigned duties that sometimes was not adequately trained for.

Title: "Worst job ever"
Pros: Transfer anywhere (only reason I worked there)
Cons: Lots of managers that all have different specs for same recipes, not on same page, kitchens are disgusting and wet, heat and serve cooking from Wearhouse to table everything is in bags, heated in boiling water, held on line and served, minimal actually cooking, out of touch with original quality and purpose, non supportive managers....
Advice to Management: Your out of touch and numbers, bottom line and bonuses are not the reason we cook and offer hospitality and corporate restaurants get to big and deviate from its original origin! Don't forget where you came from and the employees you walk on and overwork getting you those bonuses.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Fun work environment, lots of great people and guests!
Cons: We are asked to do too much for a very tight time frame and budgeting. It does not lend itself to amazing customer service.

Title: "Great job to start off with"
Pros: Training is quick and easy and the money is good. It is very much like a family when you work there.
Cons: They have started trying to cut corners so the servers are also the hosts, q.a., to-go, and busser.

Title: "Pretty good"
Pros: I liked working for this company....they were fair and able to work around my schedule.
Cons: Can't think of too many.

Title: "God Awful"
Pros: The queso is frozen and full of fat but it tastes great. Eat all you can while you work here! The food is free if the customers leave it on the plate!
Cons: The managers are all jerks. Don't expect to get your time off approved. They will reject it. I also smoked cigarettes and that was not well liked here. They judged me.
Advice to Management: Chill out a little bit before you pass judgement.

Title: "Its ok"
Pros: Flexible, great team members, good tips
Cons: Clientele act like they're at a 5 star restaurant, management could be better
Advice to Management: Learn how to talk to employees with respect

Title: "Server at Chilis"
Pros:
Chilis is a great place to work!
Very thorough training process
Cons: I loved everything about being a server here!

Title: "Not the Best Job to Have"
Pros: Server base pay is only $3.75 but plus tips, I make around $25 an hour on a good night.
Cons: The ziosk scoring system constantly keeping scores that your guests give you. Personally, my managers have been very threatening about those who have low scores. Also, guests often write vulgar or rude things in the comment section that never seem to be helpful.
Advice to Management: Don't have so much pressure on the servers to keep scores on the ziosks so high. Instead, give us positive reinforcement if we keep our scores high instead of having managers threatening to demote or fire us.

Title: "Serving for Chilis"
Pros: I've been with Chilis for about a year in a half and one of the best things I've come to love about being a server is all of the different types of individuals you get to surround yourself by. I don't know if its for this particular Chilis but I choose to believe that its not. I've grown to love the servers I'm around. You also learn valuable skills like memorization, multitasking, confidence in the way you talk and handle yourself around others, etc. The tips aren't bad either.
Cons: The feedback that customers leave on the ziosk can be a real downer especially when you start working for a company that has those to track your work/ progress as a server. There always that one customer who's decided to come into Chilis, when having a bad day, and he/she decides to take their day out on you.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Flexible schedule/ good 1st time server training/ Transfer ability
Cons: Management follows corporate "Cut-out" that may not apply to store situation. Long hours little recognition of good work. But i mean it is a service industry job

Title: "To go"
Pros: Great customer service experience and teamwork among the staff
Cons: into go I often work a split shift. It takes up my whole day but I don't really get that many hours. In a five day work week going in at 11 AM not leaving till 9 PM I still only get about 25 to 30 hours

Title: "Great company!"
Pros: The culture is great. Focused around people. #chilislove Look it up on Twitter. So much content across the brand celebrating people and what they bring to the team.
Cons: Long hours can be extreme at times. Hard to balance the five essential elements of well being. You may exceed financially but at what price do you pay.

Title: "Good so far"
Pros: Managers are very nice and they actually care about their employees.
Cons: I do not have any so far
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work

Title: "Worst Job"
Pros: literally nothing. This is the worst restaurant to work at with the most uncaring management and super stingy.
Cons:
Crappy discount only at your location
Managers make you clock out as soon as you get cut but before you have to finish all your other work which can take hours
Rude managers
Can't communicate with cooks who only speak Spanish so they mess all orders up
Advice to Management: could be a little more caring about the employees and the customers, not just focused on money.

Title: "Meh"
Pros: Cash in hand every day. Short shifts. Not especially physically or mentally challenging work. Not overly stressful. No requirement to show up super early or be there too late in general.
Cons: No chance to be upwardly mobile. Inability to better yourself or your situation within organization. Low ceiling no room to grow.
Advice to Management: Be honest with employees

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Decent pay and bonus structure. Great team members who truly care about the business and it's success. Good cultural practices. Great community involvement.
Cons: Upper management are hostile and abusive. Threatening you with your job whenever they can. Long hours and understaffed. Only hear from AD when it is bad feedback. Little to no recognition. Unorganized business structure. Upper management do not know much about operations or have seemed to have forgot.
Advice to Management: Study your cultural beliefs. If you can't follow them or live them, how do you expect anyone to. Stop with the flip flopping leadership style. Support your team not belittle and tear them down.

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: great work environment and extensive training program. Corporate leadership is supportive and always just a phone call away. I would recommend this company to anyone that enjoys a fast paced work environment
Cons: The hours are long. You have to be willing to work 50-60 hours per week. Sometimes more than that. Besides the long hours I really can't think of anything else that would be considered a con.
Advice to Management: Be willing to work harder than everyone else. It doesn't take a genius to be a restaurant manager. Willingness to go above and beyond will make you stand out in the company.

Title: "Good company overall"
Pros: Good team atmosphere, new things always rolling out
Cons: Corporate pushes to get good numbers

Title: "manager"
Pros: Can be fun at times.
Cons: Unrealistic goals and lots of micromanaging. Pay is not what it should be.

Title: "Chill"
Pros: Easy work, good way into restaurant business. Managers are decent. Lively during the weekends and big games. Good discount on food.
Cons: Some employees are just miserable, but it happens with the food industry. No tips for host. Customers complain a lot. Food is what you'd expect from a Chili's.

Title: "A good career stepping stone"
Pros: Good money if you can earn your way to the good sections

Advice to Management: Learn who your ppl are, not what numbers they are.

Title: "Hostess Review"
Pros: Good management, flexible work hours, healthy environment.
Cons: Essentially had to be a buster, food runner, and hostess while being paid only minimum wage (no tips).
Advice to Management: Tip out your hostesses if they are bussing all the tables!!!

Title: "Good money"
Pros:
Good money and fairly easy shifts, work in teams
so you don't feel so
slammed when it gets busy.
Cons: The manager was rude when something personal happened, definitely had favorites, shift times were always different.
Advice to Management: Don't act like everyone below you is scum. You can be a strong manager and still have respect for your workers.

Title: "Great employees who are always helpful"
Pros: Busy all year around. 2 of the 4 managers know exactly what they are doing every time. Most employees go above and beyond to help during a rush.
Cons: 2 managers I strongly dislike because they don't have a personality to be in the restaurant business and it makes me feel embarrassed to send them to a table. But it's not to bad.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: great company to work for
Cons: working a lot of hours
Advice to Management: doing a great job

Title: "Waiter"
Pros: You can make good money at this job if people like you. It is also very healthy job since it requies a lot of movement and multitasking.
Cons: they have a machine called the ziosk, which is a terrible invention. I was the hardest working waiter they had and most tables were very pleased with my service. I was fired solely based upon my ziosk score because I got all 4 out of 5 on every table. I would never work at a restaurant like this again or recommend them to a friend.
Advice to Management: Your GM and local restaurant managers need understand that the ziosk is only 1 small tool to judge a waiter ability; and understand that there are many different factors that will show weather a waiter is good or not.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Great people. Religious values. Lots of training
Cons: Too much micromanaging. Lots of lists
Advice to Management: Less micromanaging

Title: "Fun Place"

Cons: I had to go home at the end of night.
Advice to Management: Keep Doin what you do.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Great pay and benefits.....upper management that cares about your developement. A good company.
Cons: Long hours, late hours, but that is common to this industry.
Advice to Management: add a sociopath checklist to your management reviews

Title: "Trainer and Server"
Pros: Will work on flexible schedule. Understand when you have to call in.
Cons: Customers can e rude and management wants you to grin and bear it. The customer is always right.
Advice to Management: Keep giving pep talks every day before shift change to motivate us.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Good People, Good Benefits, good hours.
Cons: Long days, work holidays, life work balance is in favor of work

Title: "Key Team Member"
Pros: Great job to help anyone get though college or just need a good part time. The money could be very good depending on how hard you work.
Cons: Very high stress. Management always tried to lighten the mood but it is a restaurant so not much you could do. The turnover was also very high so dealing with new coworkers was always a constant.
Advice to Management: I found store managers and General managers to be good down to earth people, but it felt like they were not supported very well. My General manager was always overworked which really hurt ability to help the restaurant.

Title: "Dallas love field chili's"
Pros: Flexible with shifts changes and usually nothing to do in the mornings. Discounts on food.
Cons: Poor professionalism, management and hiring team. Hours promised not given.

Title: "tsa"
Pros: Chilis has nice and respectful managers.A clean restaurant.
Cons: It seemed there where never enough staff on duty.

Title: "I've worked at 2 different locations"
Pros: depending on location as a server chances to make money are high, great friends.
Cons: high expectations on pushing items to every guest, can be hit or miss with business which is how you make money, guests can treat you terribly, management can expect you to do literally 10 things at once and all perfectly, seniority or friends of mangers take best shifts always.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Supportive management and great training.
Cons: Poor insurance. Required to work when sick.

Title: "Food server"
Pros: People are pleasant, hours are flexible. Meetings are short and uniforms are reasonable.
Cons: Lunch rush is difficult, especially on Saturdays.
Advice to Management: No advice at this time. It seems like a good job so far.

Title: "Decent."
Pros: Flexible, good environment, good team atmosphere.
Cons: General industry issues. Sometimes put emphasis on wrong goals.

Title: "Poor management"
Pros: flexible schedule, easy to make a decent amount of money, great discount at chliis and maggianos
Cons: management lacks serving experience. more concerned about labor hours than whether the restuarant is fully staffed and equipped to handle a rush

Title: "good food"
Pros: Fun environment nice people good food
Cons: Too many servers on the floor
Advice to Management: Less servers on the floor

Title: "Line cook"
Pros: Lots of hours, plenty of promotion opportunities
Cons: Basically worked full time, expect you to do more than your job description details
Advice to Management: Try to connect better with your workers

Title: "DO NOT RECOMMEND."
Pros: The only pros are some of your coworkers, if they're professional enough to get along with. However, most aren't.
Cons: No complaints by any employee are taken seriously, ever. Coworkers literally scream and cuss each other out in the kitchen with no consequences, there is constant sexual harassment by the cooks that is swept under the rug, no team morale, no help from managers at all. All the managers care about are making it through the shift until their off days or next vacation. When the managers do actually handle a situation, it's incredibly unprofessional. They are known to cuss, name call, and basically make employees feel as though they're a complete nuisance to them. The worst and most unprofessional place I've ever worked. No bussers or food runners, and you can't count on help from anyone
Advice to Management: Actually help out your employees. Don't treat them like they're annoying just because they're busy, and solve the real issues within the restaurant instead of just making everyone get along for the time being. Don't turn female employees away when they come to you with a sexual harassment complaint just because you don't think it was that serious. Back up your employees in kitchen disputes and address issues with employees in a professional manner.

Title: "Chili's Food Server"
Employee Title: Food Server, Food Expeditor, Host, Busser
Pros: If you work full-time they allow you to opt in for benefits such as 401k, vision, health, and dental. Friendly managers and co-workers. Very flexible with schedules for those going to school, have two jobs, etc.
Cons: Constantly run out of things. Benefits not available to part-time workers. Lack of communication across the restaurant sometimes causing quality of service towards guests to drop down.
Advice to Management: All managers are great. Just step up your game and consistently make sure everyone is doing their job as they should be. Ensure staff is on their A-game as well and work a bit on inventory as far as projected sales, etc.

Title: "I'd work there again they're that great."
Pros: Amazing food, great atmosphere, good pay and meals compensated.
Cons: Only thing maybe was the late nights on the weekends closing.
Advice to Management: Let employees who want to cross train get the ability to do so.

Title: "Okay serving job"
Pros: Really great co-workers, helpful assistant managers. It is a fun, fast-paced environment with good enough training provided.
Cons: Shifts are less based on merit; factors and numbers used to evaluate employees are skewed. Menu items change so constantly, that many regulars are lost. The General Manager is involved in operations, but does not show he has any care for the well-being and development of any individual employee.
Advice to Management: Make more of an attempt to gain feedback from employees, it may boost their morale towards management and help the company with turnover. Hiring too many employees to do the same job leads to too few of shifts for employees, causing disgruntled workers.

Title: "Good place to work."
Pros: A good group of people to work with. Had a solid base of tenured team members that made the job easier.
Cons: Staffing was tough at times. Also, trying to get equipment fixed that needed fixing was difficult to get approved at times.

Title: "Excellent place to work and learn"
Pros: Great team members, awesome culture, a place to be yourself..."Like no place else!" Not many companies want you to work how you want!
Cons: Some guest are really rude, and expect that the food is all pre-cooked, rewards system is a bit messed up.
Advice to Management: Nothing, the Branson location has an excellent management team!!

Title: "First real line cooking experience."
Pros: It was a great experience for me to get to know more about the whole coming field.
Cons: It really didn't have too many bad things I can say about it besides the staff .
Advice to Management: Treat people how you want to be treated.

Title: "Bartender"
Pros: Super flexible. Transfered to four different locations. Got me through college. Excellent coworkers and life long friends. A truly fun work environment.
Cons: Snotty customers but thats everywhere.

Title: "Server/Bartender"
Pros: If you work hard and have a good attitude, there are opportunities for promotion. Chili's likes to promote from within.
Cons: Chili's, like many other places now, will put as full people on the schedule as possible and cut employees as quickly as possible. Fewer employees = more work.
Advice to Management: It wasn't management's fault. Management was great.

Title: "corporate trainer"
Pros: overall just a wonderful company to work for.
Cons: the turnover rate was a a bit much.
Advice to Management: sometimes a bit more patience would help in hectic situations.

Title: "Not a Great Place To Work"
Pros: Easy Money Great Guests Fast paced
Cons: Some coworkers were whiney about their jobs
Advice to Management: Do not threaten your employees

Title: "Chilis (Brinker International)"
Pros: Fair wages with good benefits. Good quality of life for hourly staff members.
Cons: Management forced to work many hourly positions in order to hit stringent labor goals. Poor bonus structure.

Title: "Understaffed. Mainly crappy tippers. Too much work for too little money."
Pros: The crew was awesome. Very warm and helpful. Always willing to stop and help. Thats literally the only good thing about the place.
Cons: Everything is dirty. The trivits dont get washed properly. Never enough silverware. Bottomless chips is absolute bs it takes up all your time and most of the time they have a coupon that makes them free
Advice to Management: Hire employees dont overwork your good ones

Title: "Not too shabby"
Pros: Flexible schedule, decent money, the company gives back to the community
Cons: Some people are rude and you have to be nice.
Advice to Management: Hourly employees work just as hard as managers so recognize it

Title: "Not too bad at all"
Pros: Friendly staff, good environment, pretty nice employee discounts depending on which franchise one would be interested in applying to
Cons: Like any restaurant, bad management can turn any shift/job into a nightmare. Overall, I have had very good experience with managers I have had so far.

Title: "Okay first job"
Pros: Discount is nice. The uniforms simple and comfortable. Nice staff.
Cons: Management isnt very good nor fair. The resturant is very cliquee. Its honestly like being in highschiol. Smoke breaks happen way to often and empolyees are over worked. They advancment opportunitys come only to people who the mangers are friends with.
Advice to Management: Be more professional. Listen more to your employees and what they need.

Title: "Not the worst job you could have."
Pros: Make decent money and I do feel like everybody is there to help each other out, unlike other restaurants where it's everybody for themselves in the sense tips.
Cons: Need to stop changing the everything every three months, it's frustrating for everyone!
Advice to Management: Saying "thank you for your feedback", instead of actually listening to your employees when bringing up something up is an awful way to manage a restaurant, but it is Chili's of course, so can't complain too much.

Title: "Server turned Bartender"
Pros: Flexible schedule, walking out with cash, relating with customers and growing them into regulars, growth opportunities within the company, and a laidback approach to casual dining.
Cons: Working weekends is mandatory, constant changes to both the food and drink menus, never ending push to sell more products, bare-bone work crews to cut down cost for the company to bring in more revenue.

Title: "Chilis"
Pros: Great easy money every night
Cons: To much was on the shoulders of the servers.
Advice to Management: Help out a little more

Title: "Good Opportunity"
Pros: Good company to work for.
Cons: The work life balance needs a bit of work.
Advice to Management: Ask your managers about their peers. And don't be upset by the answers that they give you.

Title: "Decent job for the younger generation"
Pros: Very flexible schedule. Able to request off whenever needed and it will get approved. Great tips. Overall it's a good job.
Cons: I have no specific cons to list
Advice to Management: More organization with employees

Title: "Server"
Pros: Good atmosphere to work in
Cons: It get busy and don't have enough room

Title: "As a Server"
Pros: Good money, team service can be rewarding
Cons: stressful management, survey system is set up to fail servers

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Very much enjoyed my job and fellow Chiliheads
Cons: was promised a relocation closer to my home that never came through, even though several opportunities came up throughout my time.
Advice to Management: Follow through on hiring promises for quality of life for employees. I was a good manager and they didn't want to lose me at my store, in return I ended up quitting the company because the commute.

Title: "Chili's Employee"
Employee Title: Front of House Staff, Back Off House Staff
Pros: Your coworkers are basically your second family.
Cons: Customer service can always be very stressful.
Advice to Management: All of my managers are very professional, kind and understanding.

Title: "Bartender"
Pros: Flexible Schedule, lucrative tips, fun environment
Cons: Physically demanding, fluctuating seasons of business, seniority matters

Title: "Server"
Pros: Great food with an excellent employee discount menu. Great business with many regulars. A nice employee app called Hot Schedules that makes it convenient to check shift times, teams, swap or request off.
Cons: Unpredictable work schedule, cut from the floor early due to "slow days". Only $2.13 hrly not including tips.
Advice to Management: Continue being supportive. Schedule according to expected volume so some servers don't get cut from the floor with a couple of hrs of being at work. If having to choose a cut, keep the server that has been on the clock the least longest being that the others have had time to make $.

Title: "Good college job"
Pros: Flexible schedule, awesome managers, good money quick
Cons: Stressful, not my ending career job

Title: "weird way to train"
Pros:
comp card for anywhere and 50% off magginos
40-50 hr work week
GM was fair with schedule no pre employment drug test
great health insurance
offer part time manger after full time 80 % salary for 4 day week, if 60% you get 3 day work week, so start with a good base,

Advice to Management: Understanding labor is your biggest controllable especially for a large corporation but it comes a point where cutting too much labor will effect your guest because execution becomes nearly impossible given the tasks at hand. Cons: Poorly managed. Poor working environment (very hot and crammed). Hourly wages for servers are half of regular minimum wage (because we keep tips). Wages heavily rely on the generosity of others (tips). No minimum gratuity for large parties. Poor flexibility for scheduling, especially for weekends and holidays. Discrimination against other employees and customers (management enjoys making fun of others secretly).
Advice to Management: I enjoyed the work I performed but the conditions I performed my duties were far extremely poor. Not only did I hate going to work because of the way management treated me but it was also always very warm and crammed working conditions. Tips were usually awful (most people are very cheap and usually tip next to nothing). The working environment was just extremely pathetic. I always felt I was being made fun of and when I tried to report this to upper management, absolutely nothing was done. So, I quit. And I have not regretted quitting one bit. Perhaps the worst working experience I have ever had. Chili's is just an awful company to work for - considering they don't care one bit about their employees or customers. But, wait.. What do they care about? Oh yeah; money. As usual.

Cons: The Ziosk system really seems to bring down good servers/bartenders. The customers are able to rate their service, but they also can rate the quality of food or the cleanliness of the restaurant. The scores directly impact the employee, which is not necessarily fair when some of the bad scores have nothing to do with the servers work. Some people allow their children to take the survey at the end and they just press buttons not realizing that it effects the employee.
Advice to Management: Stop putting so much emphasis on the Ziosk scores and focus more on training employees to be the best server/bartender they can be given that person's personality. The ziosk system should be updated to really give an idea of how the restaurant is doing as a whole rather then the individual server quality.

Being a softball player, this was the single greatest thing about working at Chili's. Flexible schedule, but required to work weekends--after you gain some seniority, there will most likely be some flexibility in this.
Cons: Had some bad coworkers and management, but they didn't last long. If you're looking to move up in the company, there aren't too many opportunities. Out of almost 10 years, I only saw a couple servers go into management, and it's not because people didn't want to or weren't qualified. None of my managers were ever servers at Chili's, they were all outside hires.

Title: "Incompetent Management"
Pros: The menu changes slightly every season, making it harder for servers to become bored with their workplace. I never participated in their healthcare plan, but from what I read (I was offered enrollment) there are definitely some good/competitive healthcare benefits. Coworkers at my location (Wayne, PA) were by far the best part of the job. Even after leaving, I still keep in touch with almost all of them.
Cons: Perhaps it was just the location in particular, but management was extremely poor. The turnover rate for managers was high, and as a server it definitely kept you on your toes -- and not in a good way. Some of the managers developed negative attitudes towards working there (the second they started their shift you could tell they did not want to be there) and were insanely incompetent; many of them did not understand the idea of leaving their personal life behind prior to coming into work and displayed clear favoritism towards particular employees. I experienced several instances of sexual harassment on part of the kitchen staff, and even after bringing it up to a manager, said manager did nothing to remedy the situation or even attempt to inform the GM (I did not feel comfortable discussing the situation personally with the GM). From what I understand now after speaking to former coworkers at the location, it appears that management is being cleaned up by the regional director (who, by the way, is actually fantastic at his job and probably the only superior I miss), so hopefully things will improve in the future.
Advice to Management: Learn how to give clear direction and provide equal expectations (regardless of favoritism and/or personal relationships) to ALL employees. Take your job more seriously, and understand that subordinates will learn from your example. If you display a poor work ethic, you can expect your staff to lack any respect for you and your position, and the restaurant will continue to function in absolute chaos. Most importantly, never -- NEVER -- trash talk subordinates in front of other subordinates. It breeds distrust among employees and an uncomfortable working environment. Every manager at this location during my time there was guilty of such trash talk. It is highly unprofessional, notwithstanding immature.

Title: "A Restaurant is a Restaurant"
Pros: Working long hard hours with a group of social people creates meaningful bonds or meaningful lessons
Cons: Every restaurant has drama. Chili's usually makes their servers do a ton of backwork after their shift (over 1 hr).
Advice to Management: Keep on keepin' on. Find a way to distribute food without dropping it on the ground. Don't get lemons with your water.

Title: "Worst Place I Have Ever Worked"
Pros: Discount Food, some nice people
Cons:
Rude Customers, Rude coworkers,
rude managers.. Hostile work environment, very much like high school politics..
Advice to Management: Stop playing favorites and actually manage your store.. And if someone is being picked on, do something about it!

Title: "Great GM, high turnover"
Pros: The GM Brian is fantastic, good clientele and location
Cons: There is no loyalty, and the assistant managers post passive aggressive emails on online messaging board. There is a high turn over rate and you feel easily replaceable.

Title: "server"
Pros: I get to meet a lot of nice people
Cons: they only offer part time.

Title: "Good Overall"
Pros: While working there i enjoyed a great sense of community with my fellow employees, the management was good, and the pay was decent enough for me.
Cons: i cant think of any cons other than the hours, i couldn't get time off when i wanted to but that is generally to be expected, right?

Title: "overall positive"
Pros: The people are great, the staff was fun, the food is good, taking tips home every night was the biggest plus, management schedules around your school schedule pretty well
Cons:
college town, so not that many great tippers
not always able to work when you want

Title: "A valuable and fun experience"
